title: Greatest Mother in the World
content:
[http://www.pma.edmonton.ab.ca/vexhibit/warpost/english/post22.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.pma.edmonton.ab.ca/vexhibit/warpost/english/post22.htm)   
   
Can anyone ID this? The poster was done in 1918 by Foringer.

 [‹ (x) Blue Velvet - Koloss {Michiel Destoop}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.typophile.com/node/11050 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sunset Marquis Hotel - Avenir {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.typophile.com/node/11038 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Oscar Morris

comments.content: [Felix Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/felix-titling/) has a similar feel, but it has no lowercase.

You could use [Weiss](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/weiss-antiqua/ef-regular/testdrive.html?s=GREATEST%20MOTHER%20WORLD&p=36) too: it has the same typical   
forms for 'M' and 'W', _and_ a lowercase. Just a shame   
the tail of the 'R' is straight. :/

Schneidler Capitals (here disguised as [Shango](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/shango/regular/testdrive.html?s=GREATEST%20MOTHER%20WORLD&p=36))   
also sports that delicious hand lettered atmosphere.

[Handle Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/handle-old-style/handle-old-style/testdrive.html?s=Greatest%20Mother%20World&p=48) is way yummy too.   
And look at that lovely curly tail on the 'R'!

Yeah, Yves! Love the Handle.   
   
The [Engravers](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=242878) [volumes](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=242879) from Agfa Monotype represents   
this very era and aesthetic. Check [Sackers Light Classic Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=203069),   
 [Light Classic Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=203062), and [Classic Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=203065) specifically.

Did I forget to mention [Carlton](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905054242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/carlton/carlton/testdrive.html?s=GREATEST%20MOTHER%20WORLD&p=48)? That's another one   
with a lowercase.
